208911-d-10-28-08-SOO.Narrative: G77'S CREW CONTACTED MALT EUROP MILL & ADVISED THEY WERE READY TO ENTER FOR THEIR SWITCH. MILL INDICATED IT WAS "OK" TO PROCEED. WHILE MAKING AN EASTWARD SHOVE MOVE TO SPOT CAR CPAA 629274 ON THE "MIDDLE" TRACK (WHICH IS AROUND A BLIND CURVE) G77'S CONDUCTOR NOTICED THE MILL'S TRACKMOBILE (TM) FACING WEST ABOUT 5 CAR LENGTHS AWAY ON AN ADJACENT TRACK.  INITIALLY CONDUCTOR BELIEVED THE TM WAS STATIONARY, BUT THEN REALIZED IT WAS MOVING IN A WESTWARD DIRECTION TOWARD G77. CONDUCTOR ADVISED ENGINEER TO BRING MOVEMENT TO A STOP BECAUSE THE TM OPERATOR DID NOT SEE THEM. G77'S MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED,BUT BY THE TIME THE CONDUCTOR GOT THE ATTENTION OF THE TM OPERATOR HE WAS 2-3 CAR LENGTHS AWAY, HADAHOLD OF 3 LOADS & COULD NOT GET THEM STOPPED. THE TM OPERATOR JUMPED OUT OF THE TM PRIOR TO IMPACTWITH THE CPAA 629274 (LOADED BARLEY). NO TRACK DAMAGE, MINIMAL CAR DAMAGE, BUT SIGNIFICANT DAMAGE TOTHE 3RD PARTY TRACKMOBILE.  NOTE: PER CLARIFICATION FROM FRA 11/12/08 'CP SHOULD TREAT THE TRACKMOBILE AS ITS OWN CONSIST TO SATISFY ELECTRONIC DATA SUBMISSION, & MAKE CLARIFICATION THAT THE TRACKMOBILE CONSIST WAS ACTUALLY OWNED & OPERATED BY THE INDUSTRY.' FORM 54 #1 REPRESENTS CP (SOO) TRAIN G77AND  FORM 54 #2 REPRESENTS 3RD PARTY (MALT EUROP) TM WHICH WERE OPERATING TRACKMOBILE ON THEIR OWNTRACK, AND RESPONSIBLE TO CAUSE.

208563-d-10-04-08-SOO.Narrative: 298-02 PULLED THROUGH CROSSOVER GOING TO OLD MAIN AND THEN CROSSOVER GOING TO W1 TO EAST END. TRAINGOT TO ABOUT 6 CARS FROM CLEARING INTO W1 TRACK WHEN THEY WENT ON THE GROUND AT THE OLD MAIN/W1 CROSSOVER.  NOTHING LEAKING, NO ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT.  INVESTIGATION DETERMINED DUE TO CAR LENGTHS AND USE OF MULTIPLE CROSSOVERS, EXCESSIVE LATERAL FORCE WAS CREATED TOWARD THE SWITCH POINT CAUSING THE WHEEL TO CONTACT THE POINT PROTECTOR AND CLIMB, LIFTING THE FLANGE ONTO THE THE TOP OF THE RAIL.

208640-d-10-09-08-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
208640-d-10-09-08-SOO.Accident Cause: Other causes relating to train handling or makeup (Provide detailed description in narrative)
208640-d-10-09-08-SOO.Narrative: 137-08 MANNED BY CANADIAN CREW HAD INSTRUCTIONS AT CSXT ROUGEMERE YARD TO PROCEED INTO WEST TRACK #3VIA #7 AND SET OVER TO #8. CONDUCTOR STOPPED AND LINED TRAIN FOR ROUTE FROM RUNNING TRACK. WHILE PULLING INTO TRACK WEST #3 FELT TRAIN PULLING HARD & STOPPED. CONDUCTOR WALKED BACK & FOUND CARS 27 -35 DERAILED. CSX ADVISES APPROXIMATELY $5,000 TRACK REPAIRS.  INVESTIGATION RESULTS FROM CSX INDICATES CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS A COMBINATION OF TRACK LAYOUT, TERRAIN, AND BUFF FORCES.  A COMBINATION OF ELEVATION CHANGES COMBINED WITH THE NUMBER OF CROSSOVERS AND TURNOUTS THE TRAIN WAS TRAVERSING, IN ADDITION TO THE BUFF FORCES OF TRAILING TONS CAUSED THE DERAILMENT. THE T.A.P.S. COMMITTEE IS IN AGREEMENT THAT THE CAUSE CODE IS H599.  THE HEAD END OF THE TRAIN WAS ON AN ASCENDING GRADE WITH THE HEAD 26 CARS, AS THE TRAIN PROCEEDED INTO W03.  AS THE ENGINEER SLOWED THE TRAIN THE 27TH CAR WASTRAVELING THRU THE TURNOUT INTO W03, THE TRAILING 46 CARS ARE NOW ON THE DESCENDING GRADE TRAVELINGAT A HIGHER RATE OF SPEED.  WHEN THE TRAILING 46 CARS MET WITH THE 27TH CAR THE BUFF FORCES CAUSEDTHE R1 WHEEL ON THE TTGX 991146 TO LIFT OFF THE RAIL IN THE TURNOUT.  THIS IMPACT ROLLED THE NORTH RAIL AT POD AND CAUSED THE 28TH THRU 35TH CAR TO FALL IN BETWEEN THE RAIL UNTIL THE ENGINEER NOTICEDTHE TRAIN WAS NOT TRAVELING NORMALLY. CSX FUTHER ADVISED CP CREW NOT RESPONSIBLE & CSX WILL ASSIGN RESPONSIBILITY ALONG WITH COMPLETING FORM 81.
